results.title: The Initial interview
results.brief_description: A marriage counselling session is presented, showing the initial interview. Afterwards a class of marriage counsellors are taught by flashbacks highlighting important moments of the interview. Role playing is introduced to mitigate the problems and fears of counsellors; interaction promotes emotional involvement of student counsellors.

results.title: The Inheritance
results.brief_description: An authentic history of America from the view point of its working people, from the early 1900’s. Shows how the first unions sprang from bitter disillusionment and traces the history of the people against the background of World War 1, the Twenties, the Depression, the Roosevelt era, and the present day struggles for civil rights. Narrated by Robert Ryan.

results.title: The Inhabited man
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation, Peter Dimond and John Dick
results.brief_description: A talking flea makes a young man aware that he has scabies though he could have countless other organisms living on his body. Anxious, the young man visits a doctor who explains to him that whilst complete prevention is not yet possible, sound personal hygiene can cut down on the incidence of scabies.

results.title: The Ingrate
results.creator_credit: American Mutoscope and Biograph Company and D.W. Griffith
results.brief_description: A young bank clerk’s love for the daughter of the bank’s president proves to be a dilemma which eventually turns into a disaster for one and all. Cast includes Herbert Yost, Florence Lawrence, Arthur V. Johnson.

results.title: The Ingot
results.creator_credit: Merton Park, Film Producers Guild, Frank A. Hoare and John Durst
results.brief_description: More than 97% of the steel produced in Britain is cast into ingots. The different methods of teeming molten steel into ingot moulds are shown in this film, which also illustrates with sectional diagrams the difference between the main types of ingot and explains the purpose for which each type is generally used.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Merton Park, Film Producers Guild, Frank A. Hoare and John Durst

results.title: The Informer
results.creator_credit: RKO Radio Pictures, Cliff Reid and John Ford
results.brief_description: John Ford’s motion picture masterpiece is about a dull witted lout who sells out his best friend, an IRA leader, for a twenty pound note, and then is overwhelmed by the consequence of his act. Based on the novel by Liam O’Flaherty. Stars Victor McLaglen.

results.title: The Informative label
results.brief_description: An explanation of how manufacturers test their products and assign ‘facts labels’ giving points to various qualities eg. durability, colour fastness. This enables consumers to compare directly the wares of different manufacturers.

results.title: The Information machine: or creative man and the data...
results.creator_credit: IBM, Charles Eames and Ray Eames
results.brief_description: Made for the IBM pavilion at the Brussels World’s Fair, it attempts to clearly place the electronic computer in the context of human development, suggesting that it is a logical extension of our desire to connect and relate things. Explains the nature of data processing, beginning with primitive man and ending with the advent of machine simulation. Drawings and animation by Dolores Cannata, music by Elmer Bernstein.

results.title: The Influential Americans
results.creator_credit: CBS, Carousel Films and Arthur D Morse
results.brief_description: A report on bold new experiments in the utilization of above-average teachers. Shows new teaching techniques and experiments. Intended to focus attention on the role of gifted school teachers and some of the methods currently used to solve major educational problems.

results.title: The Infant mind
results.creator_credit: Coastline Community College, Southern California Consortium and Harry Ratner
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Time to grow”.
Discussion of the theories of Jean Piaget on cognitive development. Interviews with child psychologists who comment on the development of thinking, learning and problem solving.
